page.title: 01Uplands South of Loch Trool
page.content: This area is uninhabited except for a Forestry Commision campsite 'Caldons' in the extreme north west (see under Loch Trool GR 02400579). The hill of Mulldonach (557m) dominates the eastern part, rising further to Cambick Hil and Lamachan Hill (716m) towards the south east. In the western part are Doon (246m) above Caldons and Craignow (500m) to the south west. The area is drained (into Loch Trool) SE to NW by Caldons Burn and its tributaries. The western half of the block is largely covered with conifer plantations reaching 250m above sea level to the north near Loch Trool and reaching up to 450m on the slopes of Cambick Hill and Craignow in the central part and to the south west.
